description: This file contains utility functions for text processing, including text cleaning, recursive chunking of text based on character limits with sentence boundary considerations, and converting tabular data into Markdown format.

methods.name: str _clean_text(t: str)
methods.description: Cleans input text by replacing null characters with spaces, normalizing whitespace sequences, and reducing multiple newlines to double newlines.

methods.name: List[str] recursive_character_splitter(text: str, chunk_chars: int = DEFAULT_CHARS, overlap: int = DEFAULT_OVERLAP)
methods.description: Splits text into chunks of specified character length, attempting to end chunks at sentence boundaries, with overlapping content between chunks.

methods.name: str tabular_to_markdown(rows: Iterable[Dict[str, Any]], max_rows: int = 50)
methods.description: Converts a list of dictionaries (rows) into a Markdown-formatted table, limiting the output to a maximum number of rows and indicating if more rows exist.

ctags.name: recursive_character_splitter
ctags.pattern: /^def recursive_character_splitter(text: str, chunk_chars: int = DEFAULT_CHARS, overlap: int = DEF/
ctags.signature: (text: str, chunk_chars: int = DEFAULT_CHARS, overlap: int = DEFAULT_OVERLAP)

ctags.name: tabular_to_markdown
ctags.pattern: /^def tabular_to_markdown(rows: Iterable[Dict[str, Any]], max_rows: int = 50) -> str:$/
